title: Is one F enough to fail the ninth grade? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is hard to imagine that not passing a single class would prevent a freshman student from being promoted to her/his sophomore year. Unlike the younger grades, in the American high school system it is all about the required credits/units required for graduation. If a person fails a single semester of a class, that course would need to be made up (especially if it is a specific graduation requirement, and/or a prerequisite for other required classes), but that could be accomplished in multiple ways, and generally would not require repeating all of the required classes.

If you have an F on the end of the year in some subject you will have to answer that subject in summer school if you have Fs in two subject yih are automatically falling the 9th or any other grade. That's how it is in my country, I don’t know where you live.
